required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of the Safety and Efficacy of the Subunit Recombinant Tuberculosis Vaccine GamTBvac
clinical_study.official_title: Multicenter, Double-blind, Randomized, Placebo-controlled Study of the Safety and Efficacy of the Subunit Recombinant Tuberculosis Vaccine GamTBvac in Preventing the Development of Primary Respiratory Tuberculosis Not Associated With HIV Infection in Healthy Volunteers Aged 18-45 Years

lead_sponsor.agency: Gamaleya Research Institute of Epidemiology and Microbiology, Health Ministry of the Russian Federation

clinical_study.source: Gamaleya Research Institute of Epidemiology and Microbiology, Health Ministry of the Russian Federation

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multicenter, double-blind, randomized (in 1:1 ratio) placebo-controlled study to assess the safety and protective efficacy of the subunit recombinant tuberculosis vaccine GamTBvac against the development of primary respiratory tuberculosis not associated with HIV infection in healthy volunteers aged 18-45 years.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Preventive efficacy calculated as Ep=(1-RR)âˆ—100%, where RR is the relative risk of developing pulmonary tuberculosis in the vaccine group compared to placebo

arm_group.description: 3590 healthy volunteers who will receive 1 dose (0.5 ml) of the vaccine GamTBvac administered twice with an 8-week interval between administrations.
3590 healthy volunteers who will receive 1 dose (0.5 ml) of the placebo administered subcutaneously twice with an 8-week interval between administrations.

intervention.description: The subunit recombinant tuberculosis vaccine GamTBvac (lyophilisate for preparation of solution for subcutaneous administration, 5.35 mg / dose)
